intro: Licaria filiformis, commonly known as the slender licaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a hairy texture. Licaria filiformis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
